frontMatter.title: Change SSH Port in Linux CentOS (Oracle Linux 8)

blogPosts.content:
On Linux systems, the default SSH port is 22. There are a few reasons
why you might want to change this number. This article will walk you
through the process of changing the default ssh port step by step.

<!--truncate-->

## Setup VM Firewall
```bash
sudo firewall-cmd --state
sudo su root
```

Update Port 22 to 8080

```bash
vi /usr/lib/firewalld/services/ssh.xml
```

```bash
cp /usr/lib/firewalld/services/ssh.xml /etc/firewalld/services/ssh.xml
firewall-cmd --reload
systemctl restart network
systemctl reload firewalld
```

## Setup SSH Config

```bash
semanage port -m -t ssh_port_t -p tcp 8080
```

```bash
vi /etc/ssh/sshd_config
```

:::info Update following values

Port 8080

:::

```bash
systemctl restart sshd
```
